## Intro

HR grouping 1+2 (HR) & 3+4 (nonHR) is a grouping based on clinical breakpoint

HR grouping 1+3 & 2+4 is a grouping based on phenotype.

Here I will explore this phenotypic classification scheme.

## Data

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```


```{r}
data_strain <- read_csv("data/features_strain.csv", na = c("NA", "-Inf")) %>% 
  filter(strain != "DA63310") %>%  
  select(-contains("oriC")) %>% 
  select(-contains("plus"))

```


```{r}
hr_testing12 <- read_csv("data/heteroresistance_testing.csv", show_col_types = F) %>% 
  rename("resistance12" = resistance)

hr_testing13 <- read_csv("~/Data/HeteroR/notebooks/modelling/data/heteroresistance_testing_gr13.csv", show_col_types = F) %>% 
  rename("resistance13" = resistance)

hr_testing_both <- left_join(hr_testing12, hr_testing13, by="strain")

hr_testing_both %>% 
  mutate(same = resistance12 == resistance13) %>% 
  filter(!same) %>% 
  filter(strain %in% data_strain$strain)
```
